compress-pdf.q1: How much can the file size be reduced?
compress-pdf.a1: Compression results vary depending on the PDF content. Documents with many images typically see the largest reductions, often 50-80% smaller. Text-heavy PDFs may see smaller reductions.
compress-pdf.q2: Does compression reduce the quality of my PDF?
compress-pdf.a2: The tool uses smart compression that targets embedded images while preserving text sharpness. The result is visually very close to the original in most cases.
compress-pdf.a3: Password-protected PDFs need to be unlocked first. Use our Unlock PDF tool to remove the protection, then compress the file.

unlock-pdf.q1: What types of PDF protection can be removed?
unlock-pdf.a1: The tool can remove both user passwords (required to open the PDF) and owner passwords (that restrict editing, printing, or copying). You must know the password to unlock the file.
unlock-pdf.a2: Yes, as long as you have the right to access the PDF. This tool is designed for users who know the password but want to remove it for convenience. Never use it on files you do not own.
unlock-pdf.q3: Will the PDF content be changed?
unlock-pdf.a3: No. The tool only removes the password protection. All content, formatting, images, and metadata remain exactly the same.

pdf-fill-sign.q1: Can I fill out any PDF form?
pdf-fill-sign.a1: Yes, the tool detects all standard PDF form fields (text fields, checkboxes, dropdowns) automatically. If your PDF has interactive form fields, they will appear in the Fill Form tab for you to complete.
pdf-fill-sign.a2: This tool creates a visual signature (an image placed on the PDF). For most informal purposes and many business documents, this is sufficient. For legally binding electronic signatures that meet eIDAS or ESIGN standards, you may need a qualified digital signature service.
pdf-fill-sign.a3: Absolutely. All processing happens directly in your browser. Your PDF and signature never leave your device — nothing is uploaded to any server.

pdf-editor.q1: Can I edit existing text in a PDF?
pdf-editor.a1: Yes. Click on any text in the PDF and the editor will detect the original font family, weight, and size. You can then modify the text and it will be rendered with a matching standard font at the same position.
pdf-editor.q2: What fonts are used for edited text?
pdf-editor.a2: The editor detects whether the original font is serif, sans-serif, or monospace, and whether it is bold or italic. It then uses the closest matching standard PDF font (Helvetica, Times, or Courier family) to redraw edited text.
pdf-editor.a3: Absolutely. All processing happens directly in your browser using pdf-lib and pdfjs-dist. Your PDF never leaves your device — nothing is uploaded to any server.

image-converter.q1: What image formats can I convert?
image-converter.a1: You can upload images in JPEG, PNG, WebP, GIF, BMP, SVG, HEIC (iPhone photos), AVIF, TIFF, and ICO formats. The tool auto-detects the format from the file's actual data, not just the extension.
image-converter.a2: You can convert to JPG (best for photos, smallest size), PNG (lossless, supports transparency), or WebP (modern format, great compression with transparency). All conversions happen in your browser.
image-converter.q3: Can I convert HEIC photos from my iPhone?
image-converter.a3: Yes! Simply upload your .heic files and convert them to JPG, PNG, or WebP. The conversion happens entirely in your browser — your photos are never uploaded to any server.

image-editor.a1: You can crop, resize, rotate, flip, adjust brightness/contrast/saturation, and compress your images. Operations can be applied in sequence — for example, crop first, then resize, then compress the result.
image-editor.a2: You can edit JPG, PNG, WebP, GIF, BMP, SVG, HEIC and AVIF images. When downloading, choose between JPG, PNG and WebP output formats with adjustable quality.
image-editor.q3: Is my image uploaded to a server?
image-editor.a3: No. All processing happens directly in your browser using Canvas API and WebAssembly codecs. Your images never leave your device.

remove-bg.q1: How does the background removal work?
remove-bg.a1: We use AI algorithms to detect the main subject and remove the background. Results depend on the quality and contrast of the original image.
remove-bg.q2: Does it work on all images?
remove-bg.a2: It works best when there is clear contrast between the subject and background. Complex images may require manual touch-ups.
remove-bg.a3: You can download the image and use an editor for touch-ups, or re-upload a photo with better contrast.

compress-video.a1: The tool supports MP4, WebM, MOV and most common video formats. The output is always MP4 (H.264) for maximum compatibility across devices and platforms.
compress-video.q2: How much can the file size be reduced?
compress-video.a2: Results vary depending on the original video. Typically you can expect 30-70% size reduction at medium quality. Higher quality preserves more detail with less compression.
compress-video.a3: The tool offers three quality levels. High quality preserves most detail, medium offers a good balance, and low creates the smallest files. You choose the best tradeoff for your needs.

trim-video.a1: The tool supports MP4, WebM, MOV and most common video formats playable by your browser. The output is MP4 for maximum compatibility.
trim-video.a2: Yes, the built-in video player lets you preview the entire video. Adjust the start and end sliders to select the portion you want to keep, and the player follows your selection.
trim-video.a3: There is no length limit. The tool supports videos up to 500 MB. Processing happens in your browser, so longer videos may take more time depending on your device.

video-to-gif.a1: The tool supports MP4, WebM and most common video formats. Simply upload your video and select the portion you want to convert to GIF.
video-to-gif.q2: How can I control the GIF file size?
video-to-gif.a2: Use the FPS and width controls. Lower FPS (5-10) and smaller width (320px) create smaller files. Higher FPS (15-20) and larger width (640px) produce smoother, larger GIFs.
video-to-gif.a3: There is no hard limit, but GIFs are best for short clips (3-15 seconds). Longer clips create very large files. The tool supports videos up to 200 MB.

video-to-mp3.a1: The tool supports MP4, WebM, and most common video formats that your browser can play. Simply drag and drop your video file to get started.
video-to-mp3.q2: What format is the extracted audio?
video-to-mp3.a2: The audio is extracted as a WAV file, which is a lossless uncompressed format. WAV files are universally compatible with all audio players and editors.
video-to-mp3.q3: Is there a file size limit?
video-to-mp3.a3: The tool supports videos up to 500 MB. Processing happens entirely in your browser, so larger files may take longer depending on your device.

screen-recorder.q1: Do I need to install anything?
screen-recorder.a1: No. The screen recorder uses your browsers built-in screen capture API. It works directly in the browser without any downloads or extensions.
screen-recorder.q2: Can I record audio along with the screen?
screen-recorder.a2: Yes, you can enable audio recording to capture system sounds along with your screen. Toggle the Include audio option before starting.
screen-recorder.a3: Recordings are saved in WebM format, which is supported by all modern browsers and video players. You can convert to other formats using video conversion tools.

audio-cutter.a1: The tool supports MP3, WAV, OGG, FLAC, AAC, and any audio format your browser can decode. The output is saved as a high-quality WAV file.
audio-cutter.a2: Yes, use the Preview button to listen to the selected portion before cutting. Adjust the start and end points using the sliders or by typing exact times.
audio-cutter.q3: Why is the output in WAV format?
audio-cutter.a3: WAV is a lossless uncompressed format that preserves full audio quality. It ensures no quality loss during the cutting process and is compatible with all audio players.

audio-converter.a1: You can convert between MP3, WAV, OGG, FLAC, and AAC. The tool accepts any audio format your browser can read and outputs in your chosen format.
audio-converter.a2: Converting to lossless formats (WAV, FLAC) preserves full quality. Converting to lossy formats (MP3, OGG, AAC) uses high-quality settings to minimize any loss.
audio-converter.q3: Is there a file size limit?
audio-converter.a3: The tool supports audio files up to 100 MB. All processing happens in your browser using FFmpeg WebAssembly — your files are never uploaded.

voice-recorder.a1: Yes, you need a microphone connected to your device. Most laptops and smartphones have built-in microphones. The browser will ask for permission to access it.
voice-recorder.q2: What format are recordings saved in?
voice-recorder.a2: Recordings are saved in WebM audio format, which is supported by all modern browsers and most audio players. You can convert to other formats using audio conversion tools.
voice-recorder.a3: No. The recording is processed entirely in your browser and is never uploaded to any server. Only you have access to your recordings.

word-counter.q1: How does the word counter work?
word-counter.a1: Simply paste or type your text in the input area. The counter instantly analyzes your text and shows the number of words, characters, sentences, paragraphs, and estimated reading/speaking time.
word-counter.q2: Is my text stored on any server?
word-counter.a2: No. All processing happens directly in your browser. Your text is never uploaded or stored anywhere.
word-counter.q3: What is the reading time based on?
word-counter.a3: Reading time is estimated at 200 words per minute (average adult reading speed). Speaking time uses 130 words per minute.

lorem-ipsum.a1: Lorem Ipsum is placeholder text used in the printing and typesetting industry since the 1500s. It helps designers visualize how content will look without being distracted by readable text.
lorem-ipsum.a2: Yes, you can choose the number and type of content to generate: paragraphs, sentences, or individual words.
lorem-ipsum.a3: The text uses standard Lorem Ipsum vocabulary arranged in random combinations, ensuring realistic-looking placeholder content every time.

case-converter.a1: We support 10 cases: UPPERCASE, lowercase, Title Case, Sentence case, camelCase, PascalCase, snake_case, kebab-case, dot.case, and CONSTANT_CASE.
case-converter.q2: Can I convert programming variable names?
case-converter.a2: Yes! The tool automatically detects word boundaries in camelCase, snake_case, and other formats, then converts to your desired case.
case-converter.a3: No. All conversion happens locally in your browser. Your text is never sent to any server.

diff-checker.q1: How does the diff checker work?
diff-checker.a1: Paste your original and modified text in the two input areas. The tool uses a Longest Common Subsequence (LCS) algorithm to find and highlight all differences.
diff-checker.a2: Yes! The diff checker works with any text including source code, configuration files, and documents. It preserves formatting and uses monospace font for code.
diff-checker.a3: The tool runs entirely in your browser, so there is no upload limit. However very large texts (100K+ lines) may be slow.

markdown-editor.a1: Headers (H1-H3), bold, italic, strikethrough, links, images, code blocks, inline code, blockquotes, ordered and unordered lists, and horizontal rules.
markdown-editor.a2: Yes. You can copy the raw Markdown text or the rendered HTML output using the copy buttons.
markdown-editor.a3: The editor runs entirely in your browser. Your content is not saved automatically — copy your text before closing the page.

json-formatter.a1: The tool will show you the exact error message if your JSON is invalid, helping you quickly find and fix syntax issues.
json-formatter.a2: You can choose between 2, 4, or 8 spaces for indentation when formatting your JSON.
json-formatter.a3: Absolutely. All processing happens in your browser. Your JSON data is never sent to any server.

base64.a1: Base64 is a binary-to-text encoding scheme that converts binary data into ASCII characters. It's commonly used in data URIs, email attachments, and API payloads.
base64.a2: Yes, our encoder handles Unicode characters including emojis, accented letters, and non-Latin scripts correctly.
base64.a3: There's no practical limit for text encoding/decoding. The tool works entirely in your browser.

regex-tester.a1: The tool uses JavaScript's native RegExp engine, supporting all standard regex features including lookaheads, lookbehinds, capture groups, and named groups.
regex-tester.a2: g = global (find all matches), i = case-insensitive, m = multiline (^ and $ match line boundaries), s = dotAll (. matches newlines).
regex-tester.q3: Is there a limit on text size?
regex-tester.a3: There's no hard limit. Processing happens in your browser, so performance depends on your device. Complex patterns on very large texts may be slower.

color-picker.a1: The tool supports HEX, RGB, HSL, and CSS rgba() formats. All values update in real-time as you pick a color.
color-picker.q2: Can I enter a specific HEX code?
color-picker.a2: Yes, you can type a HEX code directly in the input field and all other formats will update automatically.
color-picker.a3: Yes, the color picker is fully responsive and works on mobile devices with touch-friendly controls.

qr-code.q1: What can I encode in a QR code?
qr-code.a1: You can encode any text, URL, email address, phone number, WiFi credentials, or any string up to about 4,000 characters depending on the error correction level.
qr-code.q2: What are the error correction levels?
qr-code.a2: Error correction allows QR codes to be read even if partially damaged. Low (7%), Medium (15%), Quartile (25%), and High (30%) offer increasing levels of redundancy.
qr-code.a3: Yes, you can set both foreground and background colors. Make sure there is enough contrast for scanners to read the code reliably.

hex-rgb.a1: HEX (#RRGGBB), RGB (0-255), HSL (hue, saturation, lightness), and CMYK (cyan, magenta, yellow, key/black).
hex-rgb.q2: Can I input colors in any format?
hex-rgb.a2: You can input via HEX code or adjust RGB sliders. All other formats update automatically in real time.
hex-rgb.a3: The HEX input supports 8-digit hex codes with alpha (#RRGGBBAA). RGB and HSL display is for opaque colors.

url-encoder.a1: URL encoding converts special characters (spaces, symbols, non-ASCII) into percent-encoded format (e.g., space becomes %20) so they can be safely used in URLs.
url-encoder.q2: When should I use URL encoding?
url-encoder.a2: Use it when passing special characters in URL query parameters, form data, or API requests. It ensures the URL is valid and characters are interpreted correctly.
url-encoder.a3: Yes. The encoder uses encodeURIComponent which properly handles all Unicode characters including emoji, accented letters, and CJK characters.

timestamp.a1: A Unix timestamp is the number of seconds elapsed since January 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC (the Unix epoch). It is widely used in programming and databases.
timestamp.a2: Yes. If you enter a timestamp with 13+ digits, it is automatically detected as milliseconds and converted accordingly.
timestamp.a3: Unix timestamps are always in UTC. The Local format shows the time in your browser time zone. UTC format is also provided.

youtube-thumbnail.a1: Thumbnails are available in HD (1280x720), SD (640x480), HQ (480x360), and MQ (320x180). Not all resolutions may be available for every video.
youtube-thumbnail.q2: Do I need to be logged in to YouTube?
youtube-thumbnail.a2: No. Thumbnails are publicly accessible for all YouTube videos. Simply paste the video URL and download the resolution you need.
youtube-thumbnail.q3: What YouTube URL formats are supported?
youtube-thumbnail.a3: The tool supports standard youtube.com/watch URLs, youtu.be short links, YouTube Shorts URLs, and embed URLs. You can also paste just the video ID.

youtube-transcript.q1: Does it work with any video?
youtube-transcript.a1: It works with videos that have captions available, whether auto-generated or manually added.
youtube-transcript.a2: All subtitle languages available on the YouTube video are supported.
youtube-transcript.a3: Yes, copy the complete transcript with one click.

pdf-organizer.a1: PDF Organizer combines three tools in one: merge multiple PDFs, split a PDF into individual pages or custom ranges, and rotate pages by 90, 180, or 270 degrees.
pdf-organizer.a2: Yes, completely free with no registration or file limits. Everything is processed in your browser.
pdf-organizer.q3: Can I reorder pages before merging?
pdf-organizer.a3: Yes! In the Merge tab, drag and drop your PDF files to reorder them before merging. You can also see a preview thumbnail of each file.

pdf-word.a1: Simply drop a PDF or Word file. The tool automatically detects the format and converts it.
pdf-word.a2: The tool preserves text, headings, and basic formatting. Complex layouts may vary slightly.
pdf-word.a3: Yes, completely free with no registration. All processing happens in your browser.

pdf-images.a1: Yes! Use the 'PDF to Images' tab to extract pages as images, or the 'Images to PDF' tab to combine multiple images into a single PDF document.
pdf-images.a2: For PDF to Images: JPG and PNG output. For Images to PDF: JPG, PNG, and WebP input. You can mix different image formats when creating a PDF.
pdf-images.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device — nothing is uploaded to any server.

pdf-protect.q1: What type of encryption is used?
pdf-protect.a1: The tool uses standard PDF encryption with user and owner passwords. The user password is required to open the file, while the owner password controls editing permissions.
pdf-protect.q2: Can I control what users can do?
pdf-protect.a2: Yes! You can allow or restrict printing, copying text, and modifying the document. Set these permissions before protecting your PDF.
pdf-protect.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your PDF and passwords never leave your device — nothing is sent to any server.

pdf-page-numbers.q1: Where can I place the page numbers?
pdf-page-numbers.a1: You can place page numbers in six positions: bottom center, bottom left, bottom right, top center, top left, or top right.
pdf-page-numbers.a2: Yes! Choose from simple numbers (1, 2, 3), fraction format (1/N), or 'Page X' and 'Page X of N' formats. You can also set the starting number and font size.
pdf-page-numbers.a3: All processing happens in your browser using pdf-lib. Your files never leave your device.

pdf-watermark.q1: Can I customize the watermark appearance?
pdf-watermark.a1: Yes! You can set the watermark text, font size (12-120px), opacity (5-80%), and rotation angle (-90° to 90°). The watermark is centered on each page.
pdf-watermark.q2: Is the watermark added to all pages?
pdf-watermark.a2: Yes, the watermark is applied to every page of the PDF document automatically.
pdf-watermark.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

pdf-excel.q1: How does PDF to Excel conversion work?
pdf-excel.a1: The tool extracts text from each PDF page with position data, then uses coordinate-based heuristics to detect rows and columns to reconstruct the table structure into an Excel spreadsheet.
pdf-excel.a2: XLSX (Excel 2007+) and XLS (legacy Excel) files are supported. Multi-sheet workbooks will include all sheets when converting to PDF.
pdf-excel.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

pdf-pptx.q1: How does PDF to PowerPoint work?
pdf-pptx.a1: Each PDF page is rendered as a high-quality image and placed as a full-page slide in the PowerPoint file. The slide dimensions match the original page size.
pdf-pptx.q2: How does PowerPoint to PDF work?
pdf-pptx.a2: The tool extracts text content from each PPTX slide and generates a clean landscape PDF document. Complex elements like animations may not be fully replicated.
pdf-pptx.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

pdf-ocr.a1: The OCR engine supports English, Italian, Spanish, French, German, Portuguese, Japanese, and Korean. Select the appropriate language for best results.
pdf-ocr.q2: Can I OCR both PDFs and images?
pdf-ocr.a2: Yes! You can process PDF files (each page is rendered and analyzed) or image files directly (JPG, PNG, WebP, BMP, TIFF).
pdf-ocr.a3: All processing happens in your browser using Tesseract.js. Your files never leave your device.

pdf-repair.a1: The tool uses a two-stage approach: first, it tries to parse and re-save the PDF directly. If that fails, it renders each page as a high-quality image and rebuilds a clean PDF.
pdf-repair.a2: Stage 1 preserves all content including text and images. Stage 2 (image reconstruction) preserves visual appearance but text won't be selectable.
pdf-repair.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

pdf-to-pdfa.a1: PDF/A is an ISO-standardized format for long-term digital preservation. It ensures the document can be reproduced exactly the same way in the future by embedding all required resources.
pdf-to-pdfa.a2: The tool produces PDF/A-1b (basic conformance) which ensures visual appearance preservation. All content is embedded as images with XMP metadata marking conformance.
pdf-to-pdfa.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

html-to-pdf.a1: Most standard HTML elements are supported including headings, paragraphs, tables, lists, images (base64 or same-origin) and basic CSS styling.
html-to-pdf.a2: Inline styles and basic CSS properties are supported. External stylesheets are not loaded. For best results, use inline styles or a style tag in your HTML.
html-to-pdf.a3: All processing happens in your browser. No data is sent to any server.

pdf-flatten.q1: What does flattening a PDF mean?
pdf-flatten.a1: Flattening converts interactive elements (form fields, checkboxes, signatures, annotations) into static content. The visual appearance is preserved but the elements can no longer be edited.
pdf-flatten.q2: When should I flatten a PDF?
pdf-flatten.a2: Flatten before sharing finalized forms, archiving documents, or when you want to ensure no one can modify form values. It also reduces file size in some cases.
pdf-flatten.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

pdf-compare.a1: Each page is rendered as an image and compared pixel by pixel. The tool shows both versions side by side and calculates a difference percentage for each page.
pdf-compare.q2: Can I compare PDFs with different page counts?
pdf-compare.a2: Yes. If one PDF has more pages than the other, the extra pages are shown alongside empty placeholders and marked as 100% different.
pdf-compare.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

pdf-crop.a1: The tool adjusts the crop box of each page, which defines the visible area. Content outside the crop box is hidden but not permanently deleted — the original data remains in the file.
pdf-crop.q2: Can I set different margins for each page?
pdf-crop.a2: Currently the same margins are applied to all pages. For per-page adjustments, use the PDF Editor tool with its page-level controls.
pdf-crop.a3: All processing happens in your browser. Your files never leave your device.

password-generator.q1: How secure are the generated passwords?
password-generator.a1: Passwords are generated using the Web Crypto API (crypto.getRandomValues), providing cryptographically secure random numbers.
password-generator.a2: No. Passwords are generated entirely in your browser and never sent to any server.
password-generator.a3: A strong password is at least 12 characters long and includes uppercase, lowercase, numbers, and symbols.

hash-generator.a1: SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512. All are computed simultaneously using the Web Crypto API.
hash-generator.a2: Yes. All hashing happens locally in your browser using the native SubtleCrypto API. Nothing is uploaded.
hash-generator.a3: Currently the tool hashes text input. For file hashing, paste the file contents as text.

uuid-generator.a1: A UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) is a 128-bit identifier that is practically unique across all systems. Version 4 UUIDs are randomly generated.
uuid-generator.a2: The probability of generating a duplicate UUID v4 is astronomically low — about 1 in 5.3 x 10^36.
uuid-generator.a3: Yes, you can generate up to 100 UUIDs at once and copy them all with one click.

jwt-decoder.a1: A JSON Web Token is a compact, URL-safe token format used for authentication. It contains a header, payload and signature separated by dots.
jwt-decoder.a2: This tool decodes and displays the JWT contents. Signature verification requires the secret key which is not needed for inspection.
jwt-decoder.a3: Yes. The token is decoded entirely in your browser. Nothing is sent to any server.

css-minifier.a1: Minification removes unnecessary characters (comments, whitespace, newlines) from code without changing its functionality, reducing file size for faster loading.
css-minifier.a2: CSS, HTML, and JavaScript. Select the language tab before pasting your code.
css-minifier.q3: Does it change my code logic?
css-minifier.a3: No. Minification only removes unnecessary formatting. The code behavior remains identical.

sql-formatter.a1: The formatter works with standard SQL syntax including SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, ALTER, JOIN, GROUP BY, and more.
sql-formatter.a2: The tool formats SQL for readability but does not validate syntax or check for errors.
sql-formatter.a3: Yes. Switch to Minify mode to compress SQL to a single line by removing comments and extra whitespace.

image-compressor.a1: Our tool re-encodes images using Canvas API with adjustable quality settings, reducing file size while preserving visual quality.
image-compressor.a2: JPEG, PNG, and WebP images are supported. You can also set a maximum width to resize large images.
image-compressor.q3: Is there a file size limit?
image-compressor.a3: Each image can be up to 50 MB. You can compress multiple images in batch.

image-resizer.q1: Can I maintain the aspect ratio?
image-resizer.a1: Yes, aspect ratio lock is enabled by default. Toggle it off for custom dimensions.
image-resizer.a2: Instagram Post/Story, Facebook Cover, Twitter Header, YouTube Thumbnail, LinkedIn Banner, HD, Full HD, and 4K.
image-resizer.a3: Resized images are exported as PNG for maximum quality.

image-cropper.a1: Free, 1:1, 4:3, 3:2, 16:9, 9:16, and Circle crop for profile pictures.
image-cropper.q2: How do I move the crop area?
image-cropper.a2: Click and drag on the canvas to reposition the crop rectangle.
image-cropper.q3: Can I crop a circle for profile pictures?
image-cropper.a3: Yes, select the Circle option to crop a circular area — perfect for avatars and profile photos.

image-to-text.a1: English, Italian, French, German, Spanish, and Portuguese are supported simultaneously.
image-to-text.a2: Accuracy depends on image quality. Clear, high-resolution images with good contrast produce the best results.
image-to-text.a3: Yes, all OCR processing happens in your browser using Tesseract.js. No images are uploaded to any server.

meme-maker.a1: Classic Impact font with black outline, the standard meme format.
meme-maker.a2: Yes, you can change font size, text color, and enter any top/bottom text.
meme-maker.a3: No, downloaded memes are completely watermark-free.

add-text-to-image.q1: Can I add multiple text layers?
add-text-to-image.a1: Yes, add unlimited text layers, each with its own font, color, size, and position.
add-text-to-image.a2: Arial, Impact, Georgia, Courier New, Verdana, and Times New Roman.
add-text-to-image.a3: Use the X and Y coordinate inputs to precisely place each text layer on the image.

audio-joiner.a1: MP3, WAV, OGG, and FLAC files. All files are decoded and joined using the Web Audio API.
audio-joiner.a2: The joined audio is exported as a WAV file for maximum quality.
audio-joiner.a3: Yes, use the Move Up button to reorder tracks before joining.

change-audio-speed.a2: Speed changes may slightly affect pitch. The tool uses playback rate adjustment.
change-audio-speed.a3: Audio is exported as WAV format.

text-to-speech.a1: Voices depend on your browser and operating system. Most systems include multiple languages and accents.
text-to-speech.a2: The Web Speech API plays audio directly. For downloadable audio, use a screen recording tool.
text-to-speech.a3: All languages available in your browser's speech synthesis engine are supported.

reverse-audio.a1: The tool decodes the audio and reverses all sample data, creating a backwards version.
reverse-audio.a2: Reversed audio is exported as WAV format.
reverse-audio.q3: Can I use this for music production?
reverse-audio.a3: Yes! Reversed audio is commonly used for creative effects, transitions, and experimental music.

change-audio-volume.q1: How much can I boost the volume?
change-audio-volume.a1: Volume can be adjusted from 10% to 400% of the original level.
change-audio-volume.a2: Very high volumes may clip. The tool limits output to prevent digital distortion.
change-audio-volume.a3: Audio is exported as WAV format.

csv-json.a1: Standard CSV with comma separators, quoted fields, and escaped quotes.
csv-json.q2: Can I convert JSON back to CSV?
csv-json.a2: Yes, switch to JSON → CSV mode to convert a JSON array of objects back to CSV format.
csv-json.a3: No hard limit, but very large files may slow down your browser.

text-formatter.a1: Remove extra spaces, empty lines, duplicate lines, sort/reverse lines, trim, number lines, add prefix/suffix.
text-formatter.a2: Apply operations one at a time. Each operation works on the current input text.
text-formatter.a3: Yes, all processing happens in your browser with no size limit.

notepad.a1: Notes are saved to your browser's local storage. They persist even after closing the tab.
notepad.a2: Yes, click Download to save as a .txt file.
notepad.q3: Is there a keyboard shortcut to save?
notepad.a3: Yes, press Ctrl+S (or Cmd+S on Mac) to save quickly.

markdown-to-html.a1: Headers (h1-h3), bold, italic, links, images, code blocks, inline code, lists, blockquotes, and horizontal rules.
markdown-to-html.a2: Yes, switch to the Preview tab to see rendered HTML.

pdf-to-text.a3: No page limit. All pages are extracted at once.

grayscale-pdf.a2: File size may increase or decrease depending on the original content. Grayscale images typically use less data.

redact-pdf.a3: All processing happens in your browser. No files are uploaded to any server.

extract-pdf-images.a2: Yes, click Download All to download every page as a separate PNG file.
extract-pdf-images.a3: No page limit. All pages in the PDF are extracted.

youtube-money-calculator.a1: Revenue is estimated by multiplying views (in thousands) by the CPM (cost per mille) rate. Actual earnings depend on niche, audience location, and ad engagement.
youtube-money-calculator.q2: What is a good CPM rate?
youtube-money-calculator.a2: CPM varies widely: $1-3 for entertainment, $5-15 for finance/tech, $10-30 for B2B content. US/UK audiences have higher CPMs.
youtube-money-calculator.a3: These are estimates only. Actual YouTube revenue depends on many factors including ad types, audience demographics, and YouTube's revenue share (typically 55%).

youtube-embed-generator.a1: You can customize autoplay, loop, muted, controls visibility, start time, responsive layout, and more.
youtube-embed-generator.a2: Yes, the responsive option generates code that automatically adjusts to any screen size using CSS padding technique.
youtube-embed-generator.q3: Can I use the embed code on any website?
youtube-embed-generator.a3: Yes, the generated iframe code works on any HTML page, WordPress, Shopify, or other website builders.

youtube-seo-generator.q1: How do YouTube tags help SEO?
youtube-seo-generator.a1: Tags help YouTube understand your video's topic and recommend it to relevant audiences. Use a mix of broad and specific tags.
youtube-seo-generator.q2: How many tags should I use?
youtube-seo-generator.a2: YouTube allows up to 500 characters of tags. Aim for 15-30 relevant tags mixing broad topics and long-tail keywords.
youtube-seo-generator.q3: What makes a good YouTube title?
youtube-seo-generator.a3: Good titles are under 60 characters, include the main keyword, create curiosity, and accurately represent the content.

youtube-channel-name-generator.q1: What makes a good channel name?
youtube-channel-name-generator.a1: A good channel name is memorable, easy to spell, relevant to your niche, and available across social platforms.
youtube-channel-name-generator.q2: Can I change my channel name later?
youtube-channel-name-generator.a2: Yes, YouTube allows you to change your channel name, but frequent changes can confuse your audience.
youtube-channel-name-generator.q3: How long should a channel name be?
youtube-channel-name-generator.a3: Keep it under 20 characters for best results. Shorter names are easier to remember and search for.

youtube-watch-time-calculator.q1: Does playback speed affect watch time?
youtube-watch-time-calculator.a1: For the viewer, higher speeds reduce actual time spent. For the creator, YouTube counts the full video duration regardless of speed.
youtube-watch-time-calculator.q2: How does this help with playlists?
youtube-watch-time-calculator.a2: Enter a single video duration and the number of videos to calculate total playlist length at various speeds.
youtube-watch-time-calculator.q3: What's the fastest YouTube playback speed?
youtube-watch-time-calculator.a3: YouTube supports speeds from 0.25x to 2x. At 2x, a 10-minute video takes only 5 minutes to watch.

youtube-video-analyzer.a1: View count, likes, comments, duration, publish date, channel name, video tags, thumbnail, and description.
youtube-video-analyzer.a2: Yes, the analyzer shows all tags used by the video creator. You can copy them to use on your own videos.
youtube-video-analyzer.q3: Does this work with any video?
youtube-video-analyzer.a3: It works with any public YouTube video. Private or unlisted videos may not return all data.

youtube-channel-analyzer.q1: What channel data can I see?
youtube-channel-analyzer.a1: Subscriber count, total views, total videos, channel creation date, age, country, average views per video, and description.
youtube-channel-analyzer.q2: How do I find a channel URL?
youtube-channel-analyzer.a2: Go to the channel page on YouTube and copy the URL. You can also use the @handle format (e.g. @MrBeast).
youtube-channel-analyzer.a3: YouTube rounds subscriber counts for channels with over 1,000 subscribers. The displayed count is YouTube's official public number.

change-video-speed.a1: You can adjust speed from 0.25x (quarter speed) to 4x (four times faster).
change-video-speed.a2: Yes, the audio speed is adjusted proportionally with the video speed.
change-video-speed.a3: You can change the speed of MP4, WebM, and MOV video files.

mute-video.q1: Can I remove audio from an MP4?
mute-video.a1: Yes, you can remove audio from MP4, WebM, and MOV files.
mute-video.q2: Will removing audio reduce file size?
mute-video.a2: Yes, removing the audio track will slightly reduce the file size since the audio data is stripped.
mute-video.q3: Can I add new audio after muting?
mute-video.a3: This tool only removes audio. To add new audio, you would need a video editor.

resize-video.q1: Can I resize to custom dimensions?
resize-video.a1: Yes, you can set custom width and height, or choose from common presets like 1080p, 720p, and 480p.
resize-video.a2: Downscaling preserves quality well. Upscaling may introduce some softness as the tool needs to create new pixels.
resize-video.q3: What video formats can I resize?
resize-video.a3: You can resize MP4, WebM, and MOV video files.

rotate-video.q1: Can I rotate a video 90 degrees?
rotate-video.a1: Yes, you can rotate videos by 90, 180, or 270 degrees clockwise.
rotate-video.a2: No, the rotation process preserves the original video quality.
rotate-video.a3: You can rotate MP4, WebM, and MOV video files.

video-converter.a2: You can convert videos up to 500MB. Processing happens in your browser.
video-converter.a3: The converter preserves quality as much as possible. Some quality variation may occur depending on the target format.

scientific-calculator.q1: What functions does this scientific calculator support?
scientific-calculator.a1: It supports basic arithmetic, trigonometric functions (sin, cos, tan and inverses), logarithms (ln, log), square root, power, factorial, and constants (pi, e).
scientific-calculator.q2: Can I switch between degrees and radians?

scientific-calculator.a3: Yes, you can type numbers and operators using your keyboard. Press Enter to calculate and Escape to clear.

scientific-calculator.q5: Does it support order of operations?
scientific-calculator.a5: Yes, you can use parentheses to control the order of operations in complex expressions.

percentage-calculator.q1: What percentage calculations can I do?
percentage-calculator.a1: Three modes: (1) What is X% of Y? (2) X is what percent of Y? (3) What is the percentage change from X to Y?
percentage-calculator.a2: Yes, you can enter decimal values like 3.5% or any precise number.
percentage-calculator.q3: Is this calculator free to use?
percentage-calculator.a3: Yes, it is completely free with no limits. All processing happens in your browser.
percentage-calculator.a4: Percentage change = ((New Value - Old Value) / Old Value) × 100. A positive result means increase, negative means decrease.
percentage-calculator.a5: Yes, click the copy button next to the result to copy it to your clipboard.

bmi-calculator.a1: Body Mass Index (BMI) is a measure calculated from your height and weight. It provides a general indication of whether you are underweight, normal weight, overweight, or obese.
bmi-calculator.a2: BMI = weight (kg) / height (m)². For imperial units, it is weight (lbs) × 703 / height (in)².
bmi-calculator.a4: BMI is a screening tool and may not be accurate for athletes, elderly, or pregnant women. It does not measure body fat directly.
bmi-calculator.a5: No. All calculations run in your browser. No data is sent to any server or stored anywhere.

loan-calculator.q1: How is the monthly payment calculated?
loan-calculator.a1: Using the standard amortization formula: M = P[r(1+r)^n]/[(1+r)^n-1], where P is the loan amount, r is the monthly interest rate, and n is the number of payments.
loan-calculator.q2: Can I enter the term in years or months?
loan-calculator.a2: Yes, you can toggle between months and years for the loan term.
loan-calculator.q3: What types of loans can I calculate?
loan-calculator.a3: Any fixed-rate loan: car loans, personal loans, student loans, business loans, etc.
loan-calculator.a4: No. All calculations happen in your browser. No data is stored or sent to any server.
loan-calculator.q5: Does it show total interest paid?
loan-calculator.a5: Yes, it shows monthly payment, total principal, total interest, and the total amount you will pay over the life of the loan.

mortgage-calculator.q1: What does the mortgage calculator include?
mortgage-calculator.a1: Home price, down payment (amount or percentage), annual interest rate, loan term (15/20/25/30 years), and annual property tax rate.
mortgage-calculator.a2: Yes, you can enter your annual property tax rate and it will be included in the monthly payment breakdown.
mortgage-calculator.q3: How is the down payment calculated?
mortgage-calculator.a3: You can enter either a dollar amount or a percentage of the home price. Changing one automatically updates the other.
mortgage-calculator.a4: Yes. All calculations are performed locally in your browser. No data is sent to any server or stored anywhere.
mortgage-calculator.a5: You can choose 15, 20, 25, or 30-year terms to compare monthly payments.

compound-interest-calculator.a1: Compound interest is interest calculated on both the initial principal and the accumulated interest from previous periods, leading to exponential growth.
compound-interest-calculator.a3: Yes, you can enter an optional monthly contribution amount to see how regular deposits accelerate growth.
compound-interest-calculator.a4: A = P(1 + r/n)^(nt) + PMT × [((1 + r/n)^(nt) - 1) / (r/n)], where P = principal, r = rate, n = frequency, t = time, PMT = contribution.
compound-interest-calculator.a5: Yes. All calculations are performed locally in your browser. Nothing is sent to any server.

roi-calculator.a1: ROI (Return on Investment) measures the percentage gain or loss on an investment relative to its cost. An ROI of 50% means you earned half of your initial investment as profit.
roi-calculator.a2: Annualized ROI converts the total return into a yearly rate, allowing comparison of investments held for different durations. It uses the compound annual growth rate (CAGR) formula.
roi-calculator.a3: ROI = ((Final Value - Total Cost) / Total Cost) × 100. Total cost includes the initial investment plus any additional costs.
roi-calculator.a4: A good ROI varies by investment type. Stock markets historically return 7-10% annually, while real estate may target 8-12%. Any positive ROI means you made a profit.
roi-calculator.a5: Yes, a negative ROI indicates a loss on the investment. The calculator shows negative values in red so you can quickly identify losses.

tip-calculator.a1: In the US, 15-20% is standard for restaurant service. 15% for adequate service, 18% for good service, and 20%+ for excellent service.
tip-calculator.q2: How do you calculate a tip?
tip-calculator.a2: Multiply the bill amount by the tip percentage divided by 100. For example, 20% tip on :  × 0.20 =  tip.
tip-calculator.q3: Should I tip on the total including tax?
tip-calculator.a3: This is debated. Traditionally, you tip on the pre-tax amount, but many people tip on the total including tax for simplicity.
tip-calculator.a4: The calculator divides the total (bill + tip) equally among the number of people. Each person pays their share of both the food and the tip.
tip-calculator.q5: When should I tip more than 20%?
tip-calculator.a5: Consider tipping more for large groups, exceptional service, complex orders, delivery in bad weather, or when using coupons/discounts.

salary-calculator.q1: How do you convert salary to hourly rate?
salary-calculator.a1: Divide the annual salary by the total working hours per year. For a standard 40-hour week: Annual Salary ÷ (40 × 52) = Hourly Rate.
salary-calculator.q2: How do you convert hourly to annual salary?
salary-calculator.a2: Multiply the hourly rate by hours per week, then by weeks per year. For example: /hr × 40 hours × 52 weeks = ,000/year.
salary-calculator.q3: What tax rate should I use?
salary-calculator.a3: This varies by country and income level. In the US, effective federal tax rates range from 10-37%. Add state taxes for a more accurate estimate.
salary-calculator.a4: This calculator shows cash compensation only. Benefits like health insurance, retirement matching, and PTO add significant value on top of salary.
salary-calculator.q5: How many work hours in a year?
salary-calculator.a5: A standard work year is 2,080 hours (40 hours × 52 weeks). With 2 weeks vacation, it is 2,000 hours. Adjust weeks per year accordingly.

vat-calculator.a1: VAT (Value Added Tax) is a consumption tax added to the price of goods and services at each stage of production or distribution. The end consumer pays the final VAT amount.
vat-calculator.a2: To add VAT: Gross = Net × (1 + VAT Rate/100). For example,  + 20% VAT =  × 1.20 = .
vat-calculator.a3: To remove VAT: Net = Gross ÷ (1 + VAT Rate/100). For example,  including 20% VAT:  ÷ 1.20 =  net.
vat-calculator.q4: What is the difference between VAT and sales tax?
vat-calculator.a4: VAT is collected at every stage of production, while sales tax is only collected at the final point of sale. Both result in the consumer paying tax on purchases.
vat-calculator.q5: What VAT rate should I use?
vat-calculator.a5: Use the standard VAT rate for your country. Common rates: UK 20%, Germany 19%, France 20%, Italy 22%, Spain 21%, Netherlands 21%.

profit-margin-calculator.a1: Profit margin is the percentage of revenue that is profit. Formula: Margin = (Revenue - Cost) ÷ Revenue × 100. A 25% margin means /bin/zsh.25 of every dollar earned is profit.
profit-margin-calculator.q2: What is the difference between margin and markup?
profit-margin-calculator.a2: Margin is profit/revenue, markup is profit/cost. If you buy for  and sell for : margin = 40%, markup = 66.7%. Markup is always higher than margin.
profit-margin-calculator.q3: What is a good profit margin?
profit-margin-calculator.a3: It varies by industry. Retail: 2-5%, Software: 20-40%, Services: 15-25%. Higher margins generally indicate better pricing power and efficiency.
profit-margin-calculator.q4: How do I calculate price from target margin?
profit-margin-calculator.a4: Price = Cost ÷ (1 - Margin/100). For a 30% margin on a  product:  ÷ 0.70 =  selling price.
profit-margin-calculator.a5: No, margin cannot exceed 100% (that would mean zero or negative cost). However, markup can be any percentage. A 100% markup equals a 50% margin.

discount-calculator.q1: How do you calculate a discount?
discount-calculator.a1: Multiply the original price by (1 - discount/100). For 25% off :  × (1 - 0.25) =  × 0.75 = .
discount-calculator.a2: Stacked discounts are multiple discounts applied one after another. Each discount applies to the already-reduced price, not the original price.
discount-calculator.q3: Are stacked discounts better than a single combined discount?
discount-calculator.a3: No, stacked discounts result in a smaller total discount. 20% + 10% stacked = 28% effective, which is less than a single 30% discount.
discount-calculator.q4: Is sales tax applied before or after the discount?
discount-calculator.a4: Sales tax is applied after all discounts are taken, on the final discounted price. This means you also save on the tax amount.
discount-calculator.q5: How do I calculate the effective discount?
discount-calculator.a5: Effective discount = (Original Price - Final Price) ÷ Original Price × 100. This gives you the true percentage you saved.

age-calculator.a1: We calculate the exact difference between your birth date and today (or a target date) in years, months, and days, accounting for varying month lengths.
age-calculator.q2: Can I calculate age between two specific dates?
age-calculator.a2: Yes, you can set both a birth date and a custom target date to calculate the age difference between any two dates.
age-calculator.q3: Is the calculation accurate for leap years?
age-calculator.a3: Yes, our calculator accounts for leap years and varying month lengths to provide precise results.
age-calculator.a4: It shows years, months, days, plus total months, total weeks, total days, and total hours.
age-calculator.a5: No, all calculations happen locally in your browser. No data is sent to any server.

date-diff-calculator.q1: How does the date difference calculator work?
date-diff-calculator.a1: Enter a start date and an end date, and the calculator computes the exact difference in years, months, days, weeks, hours, and minutes.
date-diff-calculator.a2: No, the calculator uses the absolute difference between the two dates regardless of which comes first.
date-diff-calculator.q3: Does it account for leap years?
date-diff-calculator.a3: Yes, all calculations properly account for leap years and varying month lengths.
date-diff-calculator.a4: Currently the calculator shows calendar days. Business day calculation may be added in a future update.
date-diff-calculator.a5: Yes, all calculations happen locally in your browser. No data is transmitted.

calorie-calculator.a1: We use the Mifflin-St Jeor equation, which is considered the most accurate formula for estimating BMR (Basal Metabolic Rate).
calorie-calculator.a2: BMR is calories burned at rest. TDEE (Total Daily Energy Expenditure) is BMR multiplied by your activity level factor.
calorie-calculator.a3: The Mifflin-St Jeor equation is accurate within ±10% for most people. Individual metabolism may vary.
calorie-calculator.a4: Five levels: Sedentary (little exercise), Light (1-3 days/week), Moderate (3-5 days/week), Active (6-7 days/week), Very Active (intense daily).
calorie-calculator.a5: No, this is an estimation tool. Consult a healthcare professional or dietitian for personalized nutrition plans.

fraction-calculator.a1: We find the Greatest Common Divisor (GCD) of the numerator and denominator, then divide both by it to get the simplified form.
fraction-calculator.a2: Yes, leave the denominator as 1 (or empty) to use whole numbers in calculations.
fraction-calculator.a3: A mixed number combines a whole number with a proper fraction, like 2 3/4 instead of 11/4.
fraction-calculator.q4: What happens with division by zero?
fraction-calculator.a4: Division by zero is undefined and will show no result. The calculator handles this gracefully.
fraction-calculator.a5: Yes, enter negative numbers for the numerator to work with negative fractions.

grade-calculator.q1: How is the weighted average calculated?
grade-calculator.a1: Each grade is multiplied by its weight, summed together, then divided by the total weight. Formula: Sum(grade × weight) / Sum(weights).
grade-calculator.q3: Can I use different weight values?
grade-calculator.a3: Yes, you can assign any weight to each subject. Common weights are credit hours or percentage of final grade.
grade-calculator.q4: Is there a limit on subjects?
grade-calculator.a4: No, you can add as many subjects as needed. Click the add button to include more entries.
grade-calculator.a5: No, all calculations happen locally in your browser. No grades are saved or transmitted.

break-even-calculator.a1: The break-even point is where total revenue equals total costs — you are not making a profit or a loss. It tells you the minimum units to sell.
break-even-calculator.a2: Break-Even Units = Fixed Costs / (Price per Unit - Variable Cost per Unit). The denominator is called the contribution margin.
break-even-calculator.a3: Fixed costs are expenses that stay constant regardless of production volume, like rent, salaries, insurance, and equipment leases.
break-even-calculator.a4: Variable costs change with production volume, like raw materials, packaging, shipping, and sales commissions per unit.
break-even-calculator.a5: Contribution margin is the selling price minus the variable cost per unit. It is the amount each unit contributes toward covering fixed costs.

temperature-converter.q1: How do I convert Celsius to Fahrenheit?
temperature-converter.a1: The formula is F = C × 9/5 + 32. For example, 100°C = 212°F.
temperature-converter.a2: Kelvin is the SI base unit of temperature. 0K is absolute zero. K = °C + 273.15.
